abstract: News Analysis; cybersecurity experts say analogy that has been drawn between Pres Obama and Chinese Pres Xi Jinping agreeing to establish framework for limiting use of cyberweapons and nuclear non-proliferation agreement between United States and Russia is flawed; nature of cybercrime is vastly different from nuclear weapons, and as such agreement reached between Obama and Xi is only a small step in complex task of limiting cybercrime.
lead_paragraph: President Xi Jinping agreed with President Obama’s premise that the theft of intellectual property for commercial gain was off limits — the one area they could agree on.

headline.main: Limiting Security Breaches May Be Impossible Task for U.S. and China
headline.print_headline: Path Set by U.S. and China to Limit Security Breaches May Be Impossible to Follow

snippet: President Xi Jinping agreed with President Obama’s premise that the theft of intellectual property for commercial gain was off limits — the one area they could agree on.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
